title: To everyone saying "I stopped playing 'X' because they kept getting nerfed"
body:
Is having an intrinsic advantage really the only reason you were playing them?


I've played Vlad, Skarner, Irelia, Maokai, Nasus, Cho, Jax, Leona, Nocturne, Olaf, Nunu, Taric, and Zac all through periods where **they were considered garbage** and managed to make people whine that they're OP no-skill champs. I won much more than I lost in most cases. 

In a large majority of cases, your champion is not being gutted. They're being made reasonable. 


**If you don't think they're worth picking, you're simply on the FotM bandwagon.** 

Thanks for getting off. 

_________

Mostly in response to the people whining about the completely reasonable Ekko changes.

old. . . {{champion:86}} , {{champion:16}} , {{champion:83}} , {{champion:78}} , {{champion:2}} 

You know, those champions that riot specifically gutted because they didn't want them to be viable at some point or another. It wasn't about them having an advantage, it was about them having a ***dis***advantage.

You can also make a case for Irelia who has been repeatedly nerfed since release. Nothing else has really happened to her and she's still viable. So nerfs are pretty much the *only* reason to drop her.

Devil's advocate aside. Other than the rare specific example, I agree. Feel free to torch the bandwagon!
*(Imaginary pitchforks on sale for 25 RP each!)*

TBH, Olaf was never as bad as people claimed. 

He was always a tanky hypercarry. Most people just played him horribly wrong (melee carry lol) and said he was super underpowered.
I don't play half the champs I used to because they keep getting reworked and made exponentially less fun

I'm still crying for Taric.

Visual update was welcome, but he's just not fun anymore. As or against.

See I don't feel that. What was fun about old Taric if you went a support build? You never really did anything beyond point and click E and Q. I find it hard to reason that new Taric is less fun than that.

Taric was much more aggressive than that. 

Max R>W>Q>E. 

If they got in range of E, it was E->auto->W->auto->Q->auto->W->auto.

If they couldn't get away before your E was up again, you pop R and start the combo over again. 

He was basically a tank Lucian. He was one of the few supports that could 1v1 non-support champs, especially ADC. 

__________

Everyone that didn't like the old Taric didn't know what his passive was, or that your Q should generally only be used as a self-heal to enable aggressive play-patterns. It was garbage when used on anyone else. 

{{item:2045}} {{item:3190}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3047}}  {{item:3068}} 

His W increased the damage his team did to targets, along with being a burst itself, same with his ult. His passive combined with that made it so he did quite a substantial amount, as well as being a walking aura-buff/debuff tank. 
_____________

New Taric's Q is literally worthless. CDs are way too long. Mana costs obscene. Bonus attackspeed in between casts feels way worse than his old passive.
Too bad that his new v-neck was much more important for Riot than feelings of people that loved old Taric.

>Everyone that didn't like the old Taric didn't know what his passive was 

Which one? ;p
any of them before the current one probably
People will say that old sion/poppy/taric/fiora were better than their reworks because they want to be a special snowflake. Just let them think that.

Taric and Karma were really the only two anyone can make that claim about. 

They weren't blatant gameplay or theme issues like any of the other reworks. They just weren't popular because people didn't find their kits straightforward.

The reworks essentially completely changed them and made them straightforward champions. Its hard to say that either is better or worse considering they're completely different. 

For you to suggest they are definitely better would be a blatant lie.

New Taric is way better by gameplay standards. Every part of his kit is much more interactive with ways to maximize and counter play for the enemy. His ult is very cool too. Much better than the point-and-click stat-booster champion he was before.

"I am not the man I once was" - Taric

I mained Taric before the rework, (still one of my favorite champions) and I agree with all this: the rework was needed, he didn't really fit in in 2016. Still, sometimes I miss the Gem Knight. He was wonky and ridiculous but he was fun to play. The new one actually takes skill.

"Memories are my worst enemies." - {{champion:44}}

finally someone who agrees with me

tired of getting shouted down by riot circlejerkers because i don't think taric is fun

It's worth remembering that ultimately "fun" is subjective, and people might be disagreeing for a myriad of reasons beyond just "riot circlejerkers".

Afterall I enjoyed old Taric for his reliability, which was very much killed with his rework. I didn't find his kit particularly exciting, or even fun. But his reliability did. 

The rework was a mixed bag for me but I'm largely with Woon, visual upgrade was great, gameplay on the other hand...eeeehhhhh (unsure noises)

I stopped play taric because they kept pushing him away from offensive support. His old version could 1v3 fighters and assassins and it was awesome. Now he struggles to do anything. that and his heal is honestly weaker the more you rank it up.

Seriously. Heal still costs 140 at rank 5 even though you've only got 1 stack healing for 80. 

New Taric's a joke of design+balance choices.

He's even 'more must-pick or worthless' than before, and he's not even fun to play now. Even when he's must-pick, its only because of his W giving essentially anyone a stun and his R giving 2 seconds of team-wide immunity. His passive and Q are considered worthless.
I wouldnt mind so much if they just nerfed malz but instead they reworked him which made him not fun for me to play anymore.
I tried to play Shyvanna this season without Devourer. Nothing like being useless for the first 7 mins and then knowing the game is over if 2 lanes lose.

What can I say.
Azir challenges me in a way no other champion does.

Besides I'm not going to sell my soul for elo, lol.
I'd rather win playing what I enjoy, otherwise, for me at least, it feels worthless. Hell I've even stopped playing some of my champions temporarily because they've been busted in the past.

I don't really care for how strong/weak a champion is. The only thing that will make me stop playing a champ is if a part of their kit is changed to something I don't like. I've stopped playing Quinn, Shen, Malz, and Morde after their changes simply because I liked their old kits better. Nothing to do with champion strength.
